data.title: W.Va. man killed in Meigs County accident
meta_keywords: W.Va. man killed in Meigs County accidentNews
W.Va. man killed in Meigs County accident
data.meta_description: POMEROY – One man was killed Saturday afternoon in a single-vehicle accident on U.S. 33  in Meigs County, according to the Gallipolis Post of the Ohio State H
data.text:
POMEROY – One man was killed Saturday afternoon in a single-vehicle accident on U.S. 33 in Meigs County, according to the Gallipolis Post of the Ohio State Highway Patrol.

A 2022 Ram 1500 driven by Michael McFarland, 31, Oak Hill, W.Va., was traveling east on U.S. 33 near milepost 18 when the vehicle went off the left side of the road, struck an embankment and a tree and overturned, the patrol said.

McFarland was taken to Holzer Medical Center in Pomeroy by Meigs County EMS, the patrol said. The Gallipolis Post was notified by the hospital that McFarland succumbed to the injuries from the crash, the post said.

McFarland was not wearing a safety belt, the patrol said. U.S. 33 remained open during the initial investigation, the patrol said.

Other agencies on scene included the Meigs County Sheriff’s Office, Meigs County EMS, Racine Fire Department and Five Time Towing.

The accident, which happened about 1:15 p.m., remains under investigation, the patrol said.
